head.supplied: ¶ I have to request that the necessary arrangements be made for receiving on board the Bark "Monarch" this day, on account of the North Australian Expedition the following Passengers. ¶ ¶ Mr A. C. G...

div.p: Augustus Gregory to E. M. Sayers
N.A.E./57, MS Q429 outward letter copy book, p. 89, Dixson Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney.

Transcribed 23.12.92. To proof in Mitchell Library.
I have to request that the necessary arrangements be made for receiving on board the Bark "Monarch" this day, on account of the North Australian Expedition the following Passengers.
Mr A. C. Gregory. Dr Mueller and Mr J. Flood. And also as steerage passengers. Mr Phibbs. Chas. Dean. C. Humpherys. Henry Richards and John Fahey.
I am desirous that the Vessel should sail for Brisbane Moreton Bay, tomorrow morning or so soon therafter as the wind and weather shall permit.
